content: see also, “Autistic economics”. the fetishisation of money is everywhere, a totalising ideology that, like other hegemonies of history, becomes invisible _because_ it is totalising. Douglas Adams nailed it years ago: “This planet has — or rather had — a problem, which was this: most of the people living on it were unhappy for pretty much of the time. Many solutions were suggested for this problem, but most of these were largely concerned with the movement of small green pieces of paper, which was odd because on the whole it wasn’t the small green pieces of paper that were unhappy.”
